content:
I don't have access to the most updated information. however, i can provide you with some general information on funding opportunities that the royal society of edinburgh (rse) offers:

1. research fellowships: rse offers several types of research fellowships aimed at supporting early-career researchers. these fellowships provide funding for salary, research expenses, and travel. additionally, rse research fellowships offer opportunities for mentoring and professional development.

2. research grants: rse also provides research grants for projects across several areas of research, including natural sciences, social sciences, engineering, and humanities. the grants' size varies, depending on the requirements of the project, and usually cover research expenses, staffing costs, consumables, and consultancy.

3. enterprise fellowships: enterprise fellowships offer funding and support for individuals looking to develop their own business and become entrepreneurs. fellows receive a salary, business training, mentoring, and access to professional networks.

4. international exchange programs: rse offers international exchange programs to support researchers from scotland to work on specific projects and build collaborations with international colleagues.

5. innovation vouchers: innovation vouchers are available to small businesses in scotland to access academic expertise to solve technical problems, such as prototyping or testing new products. 

note, however, that funding opportunities and eligibility criteria may change from year to year. to get more information about the latest funding opportunities and eligibility criteria, you should visit the rse website or contact them directly.
